DOC.brief_summary: The propose study pilot randomize trial step collaborative care intervention design decrease post-concussive symptom improve post-injury functioning among sports-injured youth age 11-17 . Participants persistent post-concussive symptom ( symptom persist least two month post-injury ) recruit Seattle Children 's Hospital department sport medicine rehabilitation medicine . Consent assent obtain in-person . Participants randomize receive either step collaborative care intervention , treatment-as-usual . Participants assess range symptom area function four time point : 0 month , 1 month , 3 month , 6 month enrollment . The primary hypothesis intervention group athletes , compare usual care control group athlete , demonstrate clinically statistically significant reduction postconcussive , anxiety , depressive symptom course 6-month study . Secondary analysis assess impact intervention functional impairment include missed school day academic outcome . Exploratory analysis examine MRI finding characteristic postconcussive neuropathology , available medical record , predictor treatment response .
DOC.criteria: Between age 11 18 Have sustain head impact sport participation Have incur onset increase least three postconcussive symptom follow head impact Have increase postconcussive symptom follow head impact continue least 4 week Live parent legal guardian Live within commute distance Seattle Children 's Hospital Willing participate assessment treatment Have least one parent/caregiver willing participate assessment treatment Meet Diagnostic Statistical Manual Mental Disorders ( DSM V ) criteria psychotic disorder bipolar disorder Active suicidality Substance dependence
